intro: Scabiosa stellata subsp. insularis, commonly known as the island scabious, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and leaves with a serrated edge. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
